lib.post_correction.post_correction module¶

This module is responsible for 3 things: - Split a string into words and sentences - Fix mistakes made by OCR - Indicate per word if it is suitable for applying named entity recognition (ner)

class lib.post_correction.post_correction.PostCorrection¶

Bases: object

Small class responible for post correction.

__call__(text)¶

Receives arbitrary text. Returns a list of lists of words object with format example: {

‘word’: Hello, ‘begin_char’: 3, ‘end_char’: 8, ‘ner’: True

} Here begin/end char represents the original place inside text, can be used for locating this word. The ner key tells if this word should be used for named entity recognition.

__init__()¶

Initialize self. See help(type(self)) for accurate signature.

lib.post_correction.string_to_sentences module¶

class lib.post_correction.string_to_sentences.StringToSentences¶

Bases: object

Converts a given string to a list of lists of dicts, see ner.py for final result form.

__call__(text)¶

Returns words divided over sentences.

__init__()¶

Initialize self. See help(type(self)) for accurate signature.

static get_list_of_dict_word_and_chars(text)¶

Split the string into words where a word can be a normal word, but also a linebreak, space or any other special character.

line_word_splits(words)¶

Deal with detectable word splits caused by line breaks. For applying ner and also do post correction or modernisation it is better to look at the whole word.

replacer = <lib.post_correction.replacer.Replacer object>¶
set_ner_flag(words)¶

Set ner to False for words that match the NER (anti)pattern

split_in_sentences(words)¶

Deal with the line breaks.
